comment.author: 33290096@N03
comment._content:
I wonder if the Anglicised name was used originally, and when it was changed back to its current name of "Franz Joseph Glacier".  
Wikipedia says: The glacier was named after Emperor Franz Joseph I of Austria by the German explorer, Julius von Haast, in 1865. 
I'm sure Haast wouldn't have used the English version, would he?!

comment.author: 32741315@N06
comment._content:
Hi nzdectective. I wondered about the name too - in fact, it was one of the reasons I added these images to the set. Like you, I doubt Haast would have used that version!

I'll ask our curators if they have any clues as to why 'Francis Joseph' has been used here.

-- Courtney
comment.authorname: National Library NZ on The Commons

comment.author: 34796783@N06
comment._content: Old time photographers were tough in those days having to carry their heavy gear on location.  I am so pleased that photographs taken by my great grand father, James Ring are able to be appreciated.

comment.author: 32741315@N06
comment._content:
Welcome Deputymax! I'm really glad you found the photos here, and can see how much people are enjoying them.

best wishes, Courtney
